TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit CompilationOptions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents compilation options common to C# and VB.
Used to compare assembly identities. May implement unification and portability policies specific to the target platform. if not specified.

Docs.summary: Specifies whether building compilation may use multiple threads.

MemberSignature.Value: public string CryptoKeyContainer { get; protected set; }
member this.CryptoKeyContainer : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The CSP container containing the key with which to sign the output.

remarks.para: To sign the output supply either one of or . but not both. If both are specified is ignored.

This setting is obsolete and only supported on Microsoft Windows platform. Use to generate assemblies with strong name and a signing tool (Microsoft .NET Framework Strong Name Utility (sn.exe) or equivalent) to sign them.

MemberSignature.Value: public string CryptoKeyFile { get; protected set; }
member this.CryptoKeyFile : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The name of the file containing the public and private keys to use to generate strong name of the compilation assembly and to sign it.

remarks.para: To sign the output supply either one of or . but not both. If both are specified is ignored.
If is also set, must be the absolute path to key file.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property CryptoPublicKey As ImmutableArray(Of Byte)

Docs.summary: Specifies public key used to generate strong name for the compilation assembly, or empty if not specified.
Docs.remarks: If specified the values of and must be null. If is true the assembly is marked as fully signed but only signed with the public key (aka "OSS signing").

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<bool> DelaySign { get; protected set; }
Public Property DelaySign As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.DelaySign : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Mark the compilation assembly as delay-signed.
Docs.remarks:
If true the resulting assembly is marked as delay signed.
If false and , , or is specified or attribute System.Reflection.AssemblyKeyFileAttribute or System.Reflection.AssemblyKeyNameAttribute is applied to the compilation assembly in source the resulting assembly is signed accordingly to the specified values/attributes.
If null the semantics is specified by the value of attribute System.Reflection.AssemblyDelaySignAttribute applied to the compilation assembly in source. If the attribute is not present the value defaults to "false".

member this.Deterministic : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the compilation should be deterministic.

Docs.summary: Gets the source language ("C#" or "Visual Basic").

MemberSignature.Value: public string MainTypeName { get; protected set; }
member this.MainTypeName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The full name of a type that declares static Main method. Must be a valid non-generic namespace-qualified name. Null if any static Main method is a candidate for an entry point.

Specifies whether to import members with accessibility other than public or protected by default. Default value is . The value specified is not going to affect correctness of analysis performed by compilers because all members needed for correctness are going to be imported regardless. This setting can force compilation to import members that it normally doesn't.

Resolves paths to metadata references specified in source via #r directives. Null if the compilation can't contain references to metadata other than those explicitly passed to its factory (such as #r directives in sources).

MemberSignature.Value: public string ModuleName { get; protected set; }
member this.ModuleName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Name of the primary module, or null if a default name should be used.
Docs.remarks:
The name usually (but not necessarily) includes an extension, e.g. "MyModule.dll".
If is null the actual name written to metadata is derived from the name of the compilation () by appending a default extension for .

member this.OptimizationLevel : Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.OptimizationLevel with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies whether or not optimizations should be performed on the output IL. This is independent of whether or not PDB information is generated.

member this.OutputKind : Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.OutputKind with get, set

member this.Platform : Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Platform with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies which version of the common language runtime (CLR) can run the assembly.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool PublicSign { get; protected set; }
member this.PublicSign : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Mark the compilation assembly as fully signed, but only sign with the public key.

remarks.para: If true, the assembly is marked as signed, but is only signed with the public key.
The key must be provided through either an absolute path in or directly via .

MemberSignature.Value: public bool ReportSuppressedDiagnostics { get; protected set; }
member this.ReportSuppressedDiagnostics : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Whether diagnostics suppressed in source, i.e. is true, should be reported.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ScriptClassName { get; protected set; }
member this.ScriptClassName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The full name of a global implicit class (script class). This class implicitly encapsulates top-level statements, type declarations, and member declarations. Could be a namespace qualified name.
Gets the resolver for resolving source document references for the compilation. Null if the compilation is not allowed to contain source file references, such as #line pragmas and #load directives.
